alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Ector; Martin; Midland (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 7:43PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ector, southeastern Andrews, northern Midland and southwestern Martin Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 743 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Midland International Air and Space Port, or 11 miles west of Midland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Midland, Greenwood, Midland International Air and Space Port and Midland Airpark. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 134 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for western Texas.
